intro: Kibara polyantha, commonly known as the pink-flowered kibara, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, showy pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Kibara polyantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream sides.
